result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

10:15 AM Defendant Michael E Etchoe in court.  Attorney Brandon K. Carlson in court for Michael E Etchoe.  Prosecuting attorney Jack A. Pitzo in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  
Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Hearing scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Letter requesting Zoom
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.
Preliminary hearing on October 5, 2022 at 09:15 am.

10:22 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe. Defendant Michael E Etchoe appeared by Zoom.  Attorney Brandon K. Carlson in court for Michael E Etchoe. All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing. 

Preliminary Hearing requested. Preliminary time limits waived.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Attorney Brandon Carlson

11:32 AM Defendant Michael E Etchoe appeared by Zoom. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane.All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing. 

The Court calls the matter for Status of Counsel.
The Defendant needs to call the SPD to see if he qualifies.
The Court will adjourn and toll the time limits for prelim hearing.
THE COURT AUTHORIZES ZOOM FOR THE NEXT HEARING.
Hearing scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on August 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on August 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with Walgreens/co-defendants listed in the Criminal Complaint.

02:24 PM Defendant Michael E Etchoe in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Niki Kane appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  The Court will set this matter back for status of counsel.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  The Court will allow for the defendant to appear by Zoom at the next hearing.  Hearing scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Initial appearance on July 20, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

11:13 AM Defendant Michael E Etchoe not in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant requested an adjournment of today's court date.  State requests a warrant be issued.    Court ordered a warrant stayed until next court date.  Ext. Code #3, cash bail $1,500.00.  Initial appearance scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant has court in Illinois (DuPage County) would like to reschedule or be given another date. - Sent to CC Herring for review. Court's response: will call it on the record tomorrow to schedule another date
